channel.title: Ok this question is for the coders
channel.description:
Ok. So most of you know about the Haybale, door, attack dummy training method.
Is there anyway to edit that to make it so it's somewhere else. I am willing to rep++ for that if you tell me.
Thanks.
I Hate U

item.title: Ok this question is for the coders
item.dc:creator: @The_Guardian The Guardian
item.description:
@The_Guardian wrote:

Kk. Hope it worked out all right.

item.title: Ok this question is for the coders
item.dc:creator: @The_Guardian The Guardian
item.description:
@The_Guardian wrote:

The case ID is the ID of the object (827 I think.)
Find the ID of the object you want to train on, and replace the number of that case with the object ID.

click one

click two

item.title: Ok this question is for the coders
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

alright ill answer your question because no one has.
to make it work on a tree, enter this command

case ####:
addSkillXP((EXP#*playerLevel[SKILL#]), SKILL#)
sendMessage("MESSAGE")

replace the following with the coorosponding
####: the id of the object you want it to work on when you click it
SKILL#: the number of the skill, i.e. cooking is playerLevel[7]
EXP#: the ammount of xp to that skill u want granted
MESSAGE: the message it sends when u click it

Read full topic

item.title: Ok this question is for the coders
item.dc:creator: @Xbox_Modder Xbox Modder
item.description:
@Xbox_Modder wrote:

Find

public void hay() { addSkillXP(25, 1); }

Add this under it

public void nameofthenewaction() { addSkillXP(xpamount, skillnumber); }

Find

	[code]if (actionName.equalsIgnoreCase("hay"))
	{
		hay();
		actionName = "";
	}[/code]

Ok under this add

if (actionName.equalsIgnoreCase("actionname")) { actionanmefromabove(); actionName = ""; // leave this actionname alone! }

find

if ((objectID ==

And add this above it

[code] if ((objectID == IDHERE))
{
actionAmount++;
if (actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage(“Message when your click it”);
actionName = “actionnamethatyoumadeabove”;
actionTimer = 5; // how long you want before you can get xp again
pEmote = 0x320; //emote there
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

			}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Ok this question is for the coders
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote="† Nirvana †, post:5, topic:89444"][quote author=I Hate U link=topic=130785.msg1266324#msg1266324 date=1178355134]
Ok. So most of you know about the Haybale, door, attack dummy training method.

Is there anyway to edit that to make it so it’s somewhere else. I am willing to rep++ for that if you tell me.

Thanks.

I Hate U
[/quote]

look for the message it sends when you hit it
it will take you to a case, change the case number of the dummy, bales, or whatever to the object id of the new object
cough++cough[/quote]

Nirvana, that kind of attitude will now get you moderated.

[quote=“I Hate U, post:1, topic:89444”]Ok. So most of you know about the Haybale, door, attack dummy training method.

Is there anyway to edit that to make it so it’s somewhere else. I am willing to rep++ for that if you tell me.

Thanks.

I Hate U[/quote]

Look in an objects list for the ID of the tree. Then go to the block of code where all objects are handled and make a new case with the tree’s global object ID. Inside that case, put in your skill advancement statements. Now, save, compile, and restart your server. Anytime someone clicks on your tree, they will receive the skill experience that you originally inputed to the case.

Read full topic
